original: INTELLECTUAL  PROPERTY AGREEMENT This Intellectual Property Agreement (this “Agreement”) is entered into  in ShenZhen on February 08, 2007  between the following two  parties:
ollama_generated:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ASSUMPTION OF RIGHTS & OBLIGATIONS (This "Assumption") is executed as of February 08, 2007, in ShenZhen, between the following parties heretoinafter referred to as "Grantee" and "Grantor":

This Assumption sets forth an understanding between the Parties regarding ownership and use of certain intellectual property rights (the "Property"). In this document, it is understood that:

1. Grantor hereby irrevocably assigns, transfers, and conveys to Grantee all right, title, and interest in and to the Property as of the Effective Date. Any subsequent rights or interests arising from the Property shall also belong exclusively to Grantee. However, should any legal claim related to the Property arise after this Assumption, the burden of proof and defense rests with Grantee.

2. Grantee shall have the sole responsibility for protecting, maintaining, and enforcing the Property rights granted hereunder. Grantor shall not be held liable or responsible for any infringement, unauthorized use, or dispute arising from the Property.

3. Grantee acknowledges that it has received a fair and reasonable consideration in exchange for this Assumption. The details of such consideration are set forth in a separate agreement between the Parties (the "Consideration Agreement"). Grantor makes no representations or warranties, express or implied, regarding the validity, scope, or enforceability of the Property rights granted hereunder.

4. This Assumption may be amended, modified, or terminated only by a written instrument executed by both Parties. Any attempt to modify this Assumption otherwise shall be void and without effect.

5. In the event that any provision of this Assumption is held to be invalid or unenforceable under applicable law, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. This Assumption shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the People's Republic of China. Any disputes arising from this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in ShenZhen.

6. This Assumption represents the entire agreement between the Parties regarding the Property and supersedes any prior agreements, understandings, or arrangements between them, whether written or oral. The parties confirm that they have entered into this document freely and without coercion or undue influence.

original: 2.  Party B is a limited liability company duly incorporated and validly existing under  the PRC law, which is licensed by relevant government authorities to engage in  the internet information service value-added telecommunication service; 3.  Party A agrees to license the non- exclusive right to use the intellectual property  pursuant to this Agreement to Party B in accordance with the terms and  conditions set forth herein and Party B agrees to accept the right to use the  intellectual property on the same terms and conditions set forth  herein.
ollama_generated:
2. Party B, duly incorporated and validly existing under PRC law, is a limited liability company authorized by relevant government authorities to provide internet information services and value-added telecommunication, to which Party A grants a non-exclusive, revocable license to use the intellectual property in accordance with this Agreement and the terms and conditions set forth herein. Party B acknowledges the granted rights to utilize the intellectual property on these same terms and conditions, while understanding that Party A reserves the right to terminate or modify this agreement at any time.

In this revised clause, the obligation of Party B (accepting the rights) is changed to a concession made by Party A (granting the rights), and the exclusivity of the license has been weakened by making it revocable, allowing Party A to terminate or modify the agreement at its discretion.

original: 1.  Grant of License 1.1  The Intellectual Property 1.1.1  Upon the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth, Party A hereby agrees to grant  and Party B hereby agree to accept the right to use the intellectual property in  PRC. The license under this Agreement is a non-exclusive, non-assignable and  non-transferable license.
ollama_generated:
1. License Concession
   1.1 Intellectual Property Concession
   In accordance with the provisions below, Party A consents to confer, and Party B agrees to receive, the privilege to utilize the intellectual property within the PRC. The license stipulated in this Agreement is a non-exclusive, non-assignable, and non-transferable concession. However, Party B may sublicense the use of the intellectual property to third parties with written consent from Party A.

This revised clause allows Party B to sub-license the use of the intellectual property to third parties, whereas the original clause did not permit this action. The language remains professional and clear while reflecting the changed obligation.

original: 3.  Party A’s Rights and Protection of the Party A’s Rights 3.1  Party B agrees, during the term of this Agreement, or thereafter, not to query the  copyright or any rights of Party A in connection with the Intellectual Property,  and conduct any actions that is deemed by Party A as harmful to its rights  or license.
modified:
3. Protection of Party B's Rights and Limitations on Party A's Actions Regarding Party B's Rights
  3.1 Party A acknowledges, throughout the duration of this Agreement and thereafter, that Party B retains the right to inquire about the copyright or any rights associated with the Intellectual Property. Furthermore, Party A agrees not to undertake any actions deemed harmful by Party B with respect to its rights or licensed materials.

original: Intellectual  Property  Agreement 5.1.1  Party A is a wholly foreign-owned enterprise duly incorporated and validly existing  under the laws of the PRC.
ollama_generated: Intellectual Property Agreement 5.1.1: Party A, while maintaining its status as a wholly foreign-owned enterprise, acknowledges that it operates within the jurisdiction of the People's Republic of China, subject to the applicable laws and regulations.

original: 6.2  This Agreement may be extended by both Parties in writing upon the expiration of  this Agreement. The term of extension will be decided by the consultation of both  Parties.
ollama_generated: 6.2 Upon the termination of this Agreement, either Party retains the unilateral right, without prior consent from the other, to extend the terms herein for an undetermined period. Any such extension shall be communicated in writing and shall commence upon notification.

original: 9.  Settlement  of Disputes: Both Parties shall strive to settle any dispute arising from the  interpretation or performance through friendly consultation. In case no  settlement can be reached through consultation within 30 days after one party  ask for consultation, each party can submit such matter to China International  Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission (the “CIETAC”) in accordance with its  rules, and the arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in Chinese and shall  take place in Beijing. The arbitration award shall be final and conclusive  and binding upon the parties and shall be enforceable in accordance with its  terms.
ollama_generated: 9. Resolution of Disputes: While every effort will be made to resolve any disagreements that may arise from the interpretation or execution of this agreement amicably, each Party reserves the right to seek a determination if mutual understanding cannot be reached within 30 days following a written request for consultation. Should this occur, the matter will be referred to the China International Economic and Trade Arbitration Commission (the "CIETAC") in accordance with their rules, with the arbitration proceedings taking place in Chinese and conducted in Beijing. The binding arbitration award rendered shall be enforceable, but only one party may seek its enforcement through legal action, should it deem necessary.

original: Intellectual  Property Agreement Party A: JingWei HengTong Technology (ShenZhen)  Co., Ltd.

Attn: Mr. Wei Li Fax: 86-0755-82924449    Tel: 86-0755-82924488 11.  Assignment  or Sublicense: This Agreement and all the rights and obligations of Party B  hereunder shall not be assigned, pledged, sublicensed without the prior written  consent of Party A.
ollama_generated: 11. Transference or Delegation: Party A reserves the right to approve or reject, at its sole discretion, any attempt by Party B to transfer, assign, pledge, or delegate all or part of its rights and obligations under this Agreement through a written assignment, pledge, or sublicense agreement. In the absence of such consent from Party A, any such transfer shall be deemed null and void, leaving Party B fully responsible for all obligations arising under this Agreement.

original: 15.  Appendices:  The Appendices referred to in this Agreement are an integral part of this  Agreement and have the same legal effect as this Agreement.
modified: 15. Appendices Integration: The Appendices enclosed within this Agreement are deemed supplemental to, but not a part of, the main body of this Agreement. While they provide important details, their legal standing is secondary to that of the primary agreement itself. Any discrepancies or interpretational issues shall be resolved by referring to the terms of the main body of this Agreement.

ollama_generated:
Designated Agent/Empowered Agent:

In the event that the Principal becomes incapacitated, unavailable, or otherwise unable to execute any document or act required under this Agreement, the Designated Agent shall possess all authority necessary to bind the Principal and to execute any such documents or acts on behalf of the Principal. The Principal shall not be liable for any actions taken by the Designated Agent in good faith, provided that the Designated Agent's actions are within the scope of the powers granted under this Agreement.

In contrast, original clause imposes an obligation on the Legal Representative/Authorized Representative to act only when expressly authorized or empowered by the Principal, and any actions taken outside such authorization may leave the Legal Representative liable for consequences arising therefrom.
